original: Ahlbergr, Karl August, kyrkoherde, prost, Göteborg, f. 21/8/75 i Gällstads förs., Älvsb. 1., av kontr |prosten August A. o. Antoinette Gyzander. G. 10 m. Anny Bernstén. — Stud:ex. 93, teol. fil. ex. 96, teor. teol. ex. 98, prakt, teol. ex. 99, prästv. 00. Kommin. i Carl Johans förs. i Gbg o. v. pastor i Nya Varvets förs. 08-28, kyrkoh. i Lundby förs. i Gbg sed. 28, prost 39. Pred. v. Majornas sjukh. 21-27, lär. v. Majornas elemilärov. f. fl. 07-15, v. Kjellbergska flicksk. 07-18. Ordf. i tax:ndn 13-29, barnavindn 26-45, fullm. i prästersk. änke- o. pupillkassa 22-26, ordf. 40-42, led. av stadsfullm. 11-29, led. av folksk :styr., fattigv :styr., arb :lösh :komm., led. av styr. f. Sv. fattigv:- o. barnav:förb. 33-45 m. fl. uppdr. LNO, LVO.
translated: Ahlbergr, Karl August, clergyman, dean, Gothenburg, born August 21, 1875 in Gällstads parish, Älvsborg County, son of the district dean August A. and Antoinette Gyzander. Married to Anny Bernstén. Studied at the University, receiving his bachelor's degree in 1893, his degree in theology in 1896, his advanced degree in theology in 1898, and his practical theology degree in 1899. Ordained in 1900. Served as vicar in the Carl Johan parish in Gothenburg and acting pastor in the Nya Varvet parish from 1908 until 1928 when he became rector of the Lundby parish in Gothenburg until 1939, when he became a dean. Preached at the Majorna hospital from 1921 to 1927 and taught at the Majorna elementary school from 1907 to 1915, and at the Kjellberg girls' school from 1907 to 1918. He served as chairman of the tax commission from 1913 to 1929, the child welfare commission from 1926 to 1945, and was a delegate to the priests' widow and orphan fund from 1922 to 1926, chairman from 1940 to 1942, and a member of the city council from 1911 to 1929, a member of the elementary school board, the poor relief board, the unemployment commission, and a member of the board of the Swedish welfare and child protection association from 1933 to 1945, among others. Recipient of the Order of the North Star and the Order of Vasa.
